    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static Author[] add​(Author[] array, Author item)
      The add method is passed the array and an Author object
      1) A new Author array is created of length of the old array + 1
      2) The Authors from the old array are copied into the new array
      3) The new Author is added in the last index of the new array
      4) The new array is returned
      static Author[] fillArray​(java.util.Scanner fin, int total)
      The fillArray method 1) creates an array of author references
      2) reads the first and last name from the file and breaks that String apart into the first and last name.
      static int menu​(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The basic menu method provided by me
      static Author readAuthor​(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The readAuthor method prompts the user for the first and last name and the publisher.
      static Author[] remove​(Author[] array, int index)
      The remove method is passed the array and an index
      1) If the index is -1 or the array length is 0 then the original array is returned
      2) A new Author array is created of length of the old array - 1
      2) The Authors from the old array are copied into the new array except for the index that is being removed
      4) The new array is returned

      • menu

        public static int menu​(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The basic menu method provided by me
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object
        Returns:
        int Representing the menu choice
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
        Post:
        The input buffer is left clean

      • fillArray

        public static Author[] fillArray​(java.util.Scanner fin,
                                 int total)
        The fillArray method 1) creates an array of author references
        2) reads the first and last name from the file and breaks that String apart into the first and last name.
        NOTE: More than 2 Strings on the line means String 0 and 1 are the first name and String 2plus are the last name
        3) Reads the publisher from the file
        4) Builds an author object of last, first, publisher
        5) Puts that author object into the array
        6) When done filling the array returns the array
        Parameters:
        fin - Representing the Scanner object
        total - Representing the total number of Authors
        Returns:
        Author array Representing the filled array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fin is null or total is less than or equal to 0

      • readAuthor

        public static Author readAuthor​(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The readAuthor method prompts the user for the first and last name and the publisher. If any of the strings are null or empty the user is reprompted.
        Once all information has been read in and validated as not null or empty then an Author object is created and returned
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object
        Returns:
        Author Representing an Author object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null
        Post:
        The input buffer is left clean

      • add

        public static Author[] add​(Author[] array,
                           Author item)
        The add method is passed the array and an Author object
        1) A new Author array is created of length of the old array + 1
        2) The Authors from the old array are copied into the new array
        3) The new Author is added in the last index of the new array
        4) The new array is returned
        Parameters:
        array - Representing the Author array
        item - Representing the Author to be added into the array
        Returns:
        Author [] Representing new array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array or item is null or the array length is less than 0

      • remove

        public static Author[] remove​(Author[] array,
                              int index)
        The remove method is passed the array and an index
        1) If the index is -1 or the array length is 0 then the original array is returned
        2) A new Author array is created of length of the old array - 1
        2) The Authors from the old array are copied into the new array except for the index that is being removed
        4) The new array is returned
        Parameters:
        array - Representing the Author array
        index - Representing the index to remove
        Returns:
        Author [] Representing new array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array or the array length is less than 0 or index is greater than or equal to the array length or index is less than -1
